    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lom.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oai</catalog>
            <entry>oai:aspect.cup.cam.ac.uk:cahi1:data_e9086430a787604578e16d77f9e06a6d787bc8b6</entry>
          </identifier>

            <catalog>CUP</catalog>
            <entry>cahi1:data_e9086430a787604578e16d77f9e06a6d787bc8b6</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Refraction from water to air</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Brechung von Wasser zu Luft</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Réfraction de l'eau à l'air</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Refraction da água ao ar</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Rifrazione da acqua ad aria</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Διάθλαση από το ύδωρ στον αέρα</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Refracción del agua al aire</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This diagram shows a ray of light as it crosses the boundary of water and air.  This can be used in a labelling exercise on refraction.</string>
          </description>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">light</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">bending of light</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">normal</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">refraction</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">water</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Dieses Diagramm zeigt einem Strahl des Lichtes 
als es Kreuze die Grenze des Wassers und der Luft. Dieses kann 
in einer beschriftenden Übung auf Brechung verwendet werden.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Ce diagramme montre à un rayon de lumière en 
tant que lui des croix la borne de l'eau et de l'air. Ceci peut 
être utilisé dans un exercice étiquetant sur la réfraction.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Este diagrama mostra a um raio da luz como ele 
cruzes o limite da água e do ar. Isto pode ser usado em um 
exercício etiquetando no refraction.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questo schema mostra ad un raggio di luce come 
esso le traverse il contorno di acqua e di aria. Ciò può 
essere usata in un'esercitazione identificante sulla rifrazione.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτό το διάγραμμα εμφανίζει μια ακτίνα του φωτός 
καθώς διασχίζει το όριο του ύδατος και του αέρα. Αυτό 
μπορεί να χρησιμοποιηθεί σε μια άσκηση μαρκαρίσματος στη 
διάθλαση.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Este diagrama muestra a rayo de la luz como él 
cruces el límite del agua y del aire. Esto se puede utilizar en
un ejercicio de etiquetado en la refracción.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Licht</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Verbiegen des Lichtes</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">normal</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>

          </keyword>

          </keyword>
          <keyword>

          </keyword>
          <keyword>

          </keyword>
          <keyword>
